DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the use and efficacy of the Iconacy Hip System for total hip replacement surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Post-Market Study of the ICONACY Hip System
DOC.criteria: This must be a primary hip replacement on this hip Patient is 30 years of age or older Have hip joint disease related to one or more of the following: degenerative joint disease, including osteoarthritis or traumatic arthritis Patient is likely to be available for evaluation for the duration of the study Able and willing to sign the informed consent and follow study procedures Is younger than 30 years of age If there has been a total hip replacement on this hip in the past (no revisions allowed in study) Infection, or history of infection, acute or chronic, local or systemic Alcoholism or other addictions Muscular, neurological or vascular deficiencies which compromise the affected extremity Obesity(BMI>45) Insufficient bone quality Loss of ligamentous structures High levels of physical activity Materials sensitivity Prisoner Mental conditions that may interfere with the patient's ability to give an informed consent or willingness to fulfill the study requirements Patient is pregnant Is not able to read English language
